intro: Nicotiana hispida, commonly known as the hispid tobacco, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant is characterized by its hairy leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in temperate climates and is often grown for its ornamental value. Nicotiana hispida is also used in traditional medicine and as a source of nicotine.
